HTSMUX-test2.nxc

00001 /*
00002  * $Id$
00003  */
00004  
00005 #include "HTSMUX-driver.h"
00006 
00007 task main () {
00008 
00009   // Variable to hold measurement data from US sensor
00010   byte distance = 0;
00011 
00012   bool flag;
00013   int c,r,g,b;
00014 
00015   // configure the port for low speed I2C
00016   SetSensor(S1, SENSOR_LOWSPEED);
00017   
00018   // Tell the SMUX to start scanning its ports.
00019   // this takes 500ms
00020   if (!HTSMUXscanPorts(S1)) {
00021     // Scan failed, handle the error
00022     TextOut(0, LCD_LINE1, "Scan failed!");
00023     Wait(1000);
00024   }
00025   
00026   // The sensor in this example is a HiTechnic Colour Sensor sensor connected
00027   // to the SMUX's 2st port (msensor_S1_2).
00028   // SMUX sensor ports use the following naming standard:
00029   // If the SMUX is connected to the NXT's S1 port, it starts with msensors_S1.
00030   // If the SMUX were to be connected to the S2 port, it would start with msensors_S2
00031   // 
00032   // The second part denotes the SMUX's port, which it has 4 of.
00033   // If the sensor was connected to the SMUX port 1 and the SMUX was connected to 
00034   // the NXT's S1 port, the smuxport would be written as msensor_S1_1.
00035   // If the sensor was connected to the SMUX port 3 with the SMUX still connected 
00036   // to S1, it would be written as msensor_S1_3
00037   
00038   Wait(1000);
00039 
00040   ClearScreen();
00041 
00042   while (true) {
00043     
00044     flag = smuxReadSensorHTColor(msensor_S1_2, c,r,g,b);
00045     if (flag) {
00046       TextOut(0, LCD_LINE4, "Color:      ");
00047       NumOut(6*6, LCD_LINE4, c);
00048       TextOut(0, LCD_LINE5, "Red  :      ");
00049       NumOut(6*6, LCD_LINE5, r);
00050       TextOut(0, LCD_LINE6, "Green:      ");
00051       NumOut(6*6, LCD_LINE6, g);
00052       TextOut(0, LCD_LINE7, "blue :      ");
00053       NumOut(6*6, LCD_LINE7, b);
00054     } else {
00055       TextOut(0, LCD_LINE4, "Color Failed");
00056     }
00057   }
00058 }
00059
